TITLE.P: Delivery, installation, commissioning and acceptance of a superconducting magnetic system

SHORT_DESCR.P: Procuration of a superconducting magnetic system (cryostat) enabling measurement of terahertz-driven ultrafast processes under extreme conditions

MAIN_SITE.P: Institute of High-Field High-Repetition-Rate Terahertz facility (TELBE)

SHORT_DESCR.P: A new superconducting magnetic cryostat needs to be installed at the TELBE terahertz facility at the Institute of Radiation Physics of the HZDR, which will enable the measurement of terahertz-driven ultrafast processes under extreme conditions. Magnetic fields up to 10 Tesla and temperatures below 2 K are supposed to be achieved. This will open up new experimental possibilities for the study of exotic phenomena in a variety of materials (superconductors, "spin liquids", topological insulators, etc.). The system should be equipped with a variable temperature insert to achieve a base temperature below 2 K, and it should be optimized for optical access with large THz beams, i.e. with maximized numerical aperture, to allow highest possible THz field strength at the sample. These parameters are crucial for future studies of the nonlinear THz-induced dynamics of quantum states in matter. The scope of deliveries and services includes: - delivery at the place of usage - SAT (Site Acceptance Test) - user documentation in English or German - installation and instruction at place

TITLE.P: Delivery, installation, commissioning and acceptance of a superconducting magnetic system

INFO_ADD.P: The total value of the procurement stated under section II.1.7) and the total value of the contract/lot stated under section V.2.4) will not be published due to the keeping of trade and business secrets of the foreseen contractor. Therefore the fictive amount of 0,01 EUR has been filled in.
